doc.excerpt: Using blocks in Reflex allows you to extract and group components into smaller re-usable chunks.

data.title: Add a block
data.excerpt: Using blocks in Reflex allows you to extract and group components into smaller re-usable chunks.
data.rawBody:
--- title: Add a block excerpt: Using blocks in Reflex allows you to extract and group components into smaller re-usable chunks. --- To move the hero we created into a block, start by adding a new block under `/content/blocks/hero.mdx` and move the hero there. ```md title=content/blocks/hero.mdx

Welcome to my site

This is the a short description for the page
``` You can now use the new block on the `about.mdx` page using the `Block` component. ```md title=content/pages/about.mdx --- title: Welcome to Reflex excerpt: Description for this page. This is mostly used for the description meta tag. --- // highlight-line ``` When adding a block to a page, you can omit the `/content/blocks` path prefix. Reflex will automatically resolve the block using the block name. Blocks can also be nested in sub-directories and used as follows: `` will display the block found at `/content/blocks/about/contact`. ``` site └── content └── blocks └── about └── contact.mdx ```

data.title: Style the hero
data.excerpt: Add styles to the hero block using style props.
data.rawBody:
--- title: Style the hero excerpt: Add styles to the hero block using style props. --- The hero we added does not look like much. We are going to style it using style props. Styling components in Reflex is as easy as adding attributes to the component, just like `HTML`. ```md title=content/pages/about.mdx --- title: Welcome to Reflex excerpt: Description for this page. This is mostly used for the description meta tag. --- // highlight-start

Welcome to my site

This is the a short description for the page
// highlight-end ``` The hero now looks like this.
Preview

Welcome to my site

This is the a short description for the page
Learn more about styling component and creating themes in the [theming documentation](/docs/theming).

data.title: Dynamic Blocks
data.excerpt: Blocks can accept props just like React components.
data.rawBody:
--- title: Dynamic Blocks excerpt: Blocks can accept props just like React components. --- The hero we created has some hard-coded values. This is not re-usable. Let's change that by using props. We are going to wrap the `hero.mdx` block in a named export. The name can be anything you want. ```jsx title=content/blocks/hero.mdx // highlight-start export const HeroBlock = () => ( // highlight-end

Welcome to my site

This is the a short description for the page
) // highlight-line ``` Then replace the hard-coded values by props. ```jsx title=content/blocks/hero.mdx // highlight-start export const HeroBlock = ({ heading, text }) => ( // highlight-end

{heading} // highlight-line

{text}

// highlight-line
) ``` Update the block on the `about.mdx` page to use props. ```md title=content/pages/about.mdx --- title: Welcome to Reflex excerpt: Description for this page. This is mostly used for the description meta tag. --- // highlight-start // highlight-end ``` Now that the `hero.mdx` block can accept props, we can re-use it on other pages. ```md title=content/pages/pricing.mdx --- title: Pricing --- // highlight-start // highlight-end ```
